<Text: Castle Hill in the parish of Filleigh in North Devon, is an early Palladian country house situated 3 miles north-west of South Molton and 8 miles south-east of Barnstaple.>

Text: Castle Hill, Filleigh:  The Fortescue family became major land owners, influential in British and West Country history.

Text: Castle Hill, Filleigh:  The house was substantially reconstructed following a disastrous fire in 1934.

Text: Castle Hill, Filleigh:  It was designated a Grade II* listed building in 1967.

<Text: Castle Hill, Filleigh:  The park and gardens are Grade I listed in the National Register of Historic Parks and Gardens.>

Text: Castle Hill, Filleigh:  Today the property is leased by Eleanor, Countess of Arran (born 1949), the grand-daughter of Hugh Fortescue, 5th Earl Fortescue (1888–1958).
Triplets:<Eleanor
8:
--------------------
<Text: Castle Hill, Filleigh:  The only historic residence of the Fortescue family now remaining as a seat of the Earls Fortescue is Ebrington Manor in Gloucestershire, a very modest building in comparison to Castle Hill.>
